[[New Bern, North Carolina]]
[[Atlanta|Atlanta, Georgia]] | cinematography = Kramer Morgenthau
Jan Richter-Friis | runtime = 41–43 minutes | channel = [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]] | picture_format = [[720p]] ([[16:9]] [[High-definition television|HDTV]]) | audio_format = [[Dolby Digital]] | first_aired = {{Start date|2013|9|16}} | last_aired = {{End date|2017|3|31}} | website = http://www.fox.com/sleepy-hollow/ }} '''''Sleepy Hollow''''' is an American [[supernatural]] [[drama]] [[television program|television series]] that aired on [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]] from September 16, 2013 to March 31, 2017.{{cite web|url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/news/2013/06/26/fox-announces-fall-premiere-dates-for-the-2013-2014-season-545310/20130626fox01/|title=FOX Announces Fall Premiere Dates for the 2013-2014 Season|date=June 29, 2013|work=The Futon Critic|accessdate=July 4, 2013}}{{cite web|url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/news/2013/05/13/fox-announces-primetime-slate-for-2013-2014-season-254005/20130513fox01/|title=FOX Announces Primetime Slate for 2013-2014 Season|date=May 13, 2013|work=The Futon Critic|accessdate=May 13, 2013}} The series is loosely based on the 1820 [[Halloween]] [[short story]] "[[The Legend of Sleepy Hollow]]" by [[Washington Irving]] with added concepts from "[[Rip Van Winkle]]," also by Irving. The series is initially set in real-life [[Sleepy Hollow, New York]], although it portrays the town as much larger than it actually is. For the fourth and final season, the setting moved to [[Washington, D.C.]] In October 2013, ''Sleepy Hollow'' was renewed for a second season with 13 episodes.{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/sleepy-hollow-renewed-second-season-635530|title='Sleepy Hollow' Renewed for Second Season at Fox|work=Hollywood Reporter|date=October 3, 2014|accessdate=April 17, 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2013/10/03/sleepy-hollow-gets-surprise-renewal-for-second-season|title='Sleepy Hollow' gets surprise renewal for second season|work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|publisher=[[Time Inc.]]|last=Hibberd|first=James|date=January 17, 2015|accessdate=April 17, 2015}} The season was extended to 18 episodes in May 2014.{{Cite web|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2014/05/07/sleepy-hollow-season-2|title='Sleepy Hollow' gets more episodes for 'epic' season 2|work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|publisher=[[Time Inc.]]|last=Hibberd|first=James|date=May 7, 2014|accessdate=April 17, 2015}} Early in March 2015, ''Sleepy Hollow'' [[showrunner]] [[Mark Goffman]] left the series after the second season.{{cite web|url=http://tvseriesfinale.com/tv-show/sleepy-hollow-season-three-renewal-for-fox-tv-show-35946/|title=Sleepy Hollow: Season Three Renewal for FOX TV Show|work=tvseriesfinale.com|date=March 18, 2015|accessdate=April 17, 2015}} On March 18, 2015, ''Sleepy Hollow'' was renewed for an 18-episode third season by Fox with a new showrunner, Clifton Campbell, taking over.{{cite web|url=http://tvline.com/2015/03/18/sleepy-hollow-season-3-renewal-clifton-campbell-new-showrunner/|title=Sleepy Hollow Snags Season 3 Renewal — and a New Showrunner|work=TVLine|last=Ausiello|first=Michael|date=March 18, 2015|accessdate=March 20, 2015}} On May 13, 2016, Fox renewed the show for a fourth season which premiered on January 6, 2017.{{cite web|url=http://tvline.com/2016/05/13/sleepy-hollow-renewed-season-4-fox/|title=Sleepy Hollow Renewed for Season 4|work=TVLine|last=Roots|first=Kimberly|date=May 13, 2016|accessdate=May 13, 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2016/11/03/fox-premiere-dates-bones-sleepy-hollow|title=Fox sets premiere dates for Bones, Sleepy Hollow, more|work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|last=Robinson|first=Will|date=November 3, 2016|accessdate=November 4, 2016}} Albert Kim, previously an executive producer on the show, was named co-showrunner for the fourth season.{{Cite web|url=http://www.foxflash.com/fox/sleepy-hollow/bios/albert-kim-executive-producerco-showrunner-sleepy-hollow|title=Bios {{!}} Foxflash|website=www.foxflash.com|language=en|access-date=2017-05-22}} The show was officially cancelled on May 9, 2017.{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2017/05/sleepy-hollow-canceled-fox-four-seaons-1202087753//|title=‘Sleepy Hollow’ Canceled By Fox After Four Seasons|work=TVLine|last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|date=May 9, 2017|accessdate=May 9, 2017}} ==Summary== In 1781, [[Ichabod Crane]] works for [[George Washington]] as a [[double agent]]. Crane beheads a [[Headless Horseman (Legend of Sleepy Hollow)|Horseman]], who doesn't die; in desperation, Crane wins with a mutual blow. However, Crane next awakes in 2013 Sleepy Hollow with Washington's bible to guide him; he meets Lt. Abigail Mills, and learns the Horseman is back. Crane learns he and Abbie are the Witnesses and the Horseman is [[Death]]; should he get his head back, or his master, [[Moloch]], be released from [[Purgatory]], the End of Days will occur. Crane also learns his wife, Katrina, was a witch banished to Purgatory for saving him as his blunder linked his life with the Horseman's. Fighting off Moloch's army of demons, Crane learns the Horseman of War is his own son Jeremy Crane/Henry Parish, who loathes him and Katrina for abandoning him; he also learns "Headless" is his former friend Abraham Von Brunt. They manage to defeat Moloch, but at the cost of releasing everything trapped in Purgatory, including demons looking for a replacement for Moloch. Henry gets Katrina to side with him to awaken the descendants of their coven, but both are regretfully killed by Crane. In the following months, Crane investigates all myths regarding the Witnesses, learning that Moloch was the first of the Seven Tribulations. The second comes in the form of Pandora, and her master the Hidden One, an ancient Sumerian god. As Moloch is dead (and thus cannot end the world), Crane gives the Horseman back his head, allowing him to destroy Pandora; however, the head is sucked into her box, which is destroyed. This battle cost Abigail her soul. Learning that there will always be two Witnesses, Crane vows to find her replacement to face the last five Tribulations. Relocating to Washington D.C., Crane discovers the next Witness is a little girl named Molly; Crane works with her mother Agent Diana Thomas of Homeland Security to combat supernatural threats until Molly is old enough to help. Crane also allies with Agency 355 agents Jake Wells and Alex Norwood, taking command of the organization as Washington wished. The third tribulation comes in the form of Malcolm Dreyfuss, who sold his soul to build his business; he seeks immortality to avoid dying. After Dreyfuss becomes immortal, he decides to assemble the Four Horsemen to kill the president and takeover America. A woman named Lara arrives from the future Dreyfuss wishes to create, revealing herself to be an alternate version of Molly; as a result of being in her prime, Lara gains the Witness title from Molly, freeing her past self from the burden. Crane is forced to make a [[deal with the devil]] for a piece of the [[philosophers' stone]] to strip Dreyfuss of his immortality, sending Dreyfuss to hell. While Lara goes on a journey to discover her place in the world, Crane continues working with Agent Thomas to combat supernatural threats with the hope he can escape his bargain with the devil. ==Cast and characters== {{main|List of Sleepy Hollow characters}} * [[Tom Mison]] as [[Ichabod Crane]], Esq., soldier of the [[American Revolutionary War]] and Biblical witness. Ichabod Crane also acts as both a Sheriff's consultant and an FBI consultant whilst working with Mills. * [[Nicole Beharie]] as Abbie Mills (born Grace Abigail Mills), Sheriff's Lieutenant, FBI Agent and Biblical witness (seasons 1–3) * [[Orlando Jones]] as Frank Irving, Sheriff's captain (seasons 1–2) * [[Katia Winter]] as [[Katrina Van Tassel|Katrina Crane]] (born Katrina Van Tassel), a witch (seasons 1–2) * [[Lyndie Greenwood]] as Jenny Mills, artifact hunter (seasons 2–4; guest season 1) * [[John Noble]] as Henry Parish (born Jeremy Crane), the son of Ichabod and Katrina, and the Horseman of War (season 2; guest season 1, 3–4) * [[Nikki Reed]] as [[Betsy Ross]], soldier of the revolutionary war (season 3) * [[Shannyn Sossamon]] as [[Pandora]], a supernatural entity (season 3) * [[Zach Appelman]] as Joseph Corbin, E.M.T., artifact hunter and Wendigo (season 3; guest season 2) * [[Lance Gross]] as Daniel Reynolds, FBI Agent (season 3) * [[Jessica Camacho]] as Sophie Foster, FBI Agent (season 3) * [[Janina Gavankar]] as Diana Thomas, Homeland Security Agent (season 4) * Jerry MacKinnon as Jake Wells, research analyst at Agency 355 and The Vault (season 4) * [[Rachel Melvin]] as Alex Norwood, engineer at Agency 355 and The Vault (season 4) * Oona Yaffe as Molly Thomas, Diana's 11-year-old daughter, and Biblical witness (season 4) * [[Jeremy Davies]] as Malcolm Dreyfuss, a billionaire tech mogul, who is seeking out mystical artifacts (season 4) ==Development and production== The pilot episode was filmed in [[Gastonia, North Carolina|Gastonia]], [[Salisbury, North Carolina|Salisbury]], and [[Charlotte, North Carolina]].{{cite web |url=http://www.gastongazette.com/film-crew-shoots-scene-for-tv-pilot-in-downtown-gastonia-1.116983 | title=Film crew shoots scene for TV pilot in downtown Gastonia | publisher=The Gaston Gazette | date=March 25, 2013 | accessdate=September 29, 2013 | author=Barrett, Michael}}{{cite web |url=http://www.gastongazette.com/spotlight/could-national-tv-audience-discover-gastonia-in-sleepy-hollow-video-link-1.184807 | title=Could national TV audience discover Gastonia in 'Sleepy Hollow?' (video link) | publisher=The Gaston Gazette | date=August 9, 2013 | accessdate=September 29, 2013 | author=Allen, Wade}}{{cite web |url=http://www.gastongazette.com/spotlight/gastonia-coming-to-the-small-screen-monday-night-1.202898 | title=Gastonia coming to the small screen Monday night | publisher=The Gaston Gazette | date=September 14, 2013 | accessdate=September 29, 2013 | author=Turbyfill, Diane}}{{cite web |url=http://www.salisburypost.com/article/20130514/SP01/130519853/1006/sleepy-hollow-trailer-features-salisbury-series-to-air-at-9-pm-mondays | title='Sleepy Hollow' trailer features Salisbury; series to air at 9 p.m. Mondays | publisher=Salisbury Post | date=May 14, 2013 | accessdate=May 18, 2013 | author=Ford, Emily}}{{cite web|author=Emily Ford Email Facebook Twitter $(".story .meta").dd(); |url=http://www.salisburypost.com/article/20130919/SP01/130919701/1023/salisbury-musician-spots-himself-as-ichabod-in-x2018-sleepy-hollow-x2019-premiere |title=Salisbury musician spots himself as Ichabod in 'Sleepy Hollow' premiere |publisher=Salisbury Post |date=June 7, 2013 |accessdate=September 22, 2013}} The rest of the first season and the second season were filmed in [[Wilmington, North Carolina|Wilmington]], North Carolina. The third and fourth seasons were filmed in [[Conyers, Georgia|Conyers]] and [[Lawrenceville, Georgia|Lawrenceville]], [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]], in the metro [[Atlanta|Atlanta area.]]{{Cite web|url=http://radiotvtalk.blog.ajc.com/2015/09/30/sleepy-hollow-comes-to-atlanta-season-3-with-hopes-for-revival/|title=‘Sleepy Hollow’ comes to Atlanta season 3 with hopes for revival {{!}} Radio and TV Talk|access-date=2016-03-06}} Aerial footage for the series is filmed over the actual village of Sleepy Hollow and the surrounding [[Tappan Zee]] region of New York. ==Episodes== {{main|List of Sleepy Hollow episodes}} {{:List of Sleepy Hollow episodes}} ==Broadcast== ''Sleepy Hollow'' airs simultaneously on [[Global Television Network|Global]] in Canada.{{cite web |url=http://www.tommison.co.uk/content/sleepy-hollow-picked-global-canada | title=Sleepy Hollow Picked Up by Global in Canada | publisher=tommison.co.uk | date=June 5, 2013 | accessdate=August 25, 2013}} For the third season, the show moved to [[CTV Two]]. In [[India]], it airs on [[Star World|Star World Premiere HD]] (only in high-definition) and on [[Star World India]] (both in standard and high definitions). In Australia, the series premiered on September 17, 2013 on [[Network Ten]].{{cite web|url=http://www.tvtonight.com.au/2013/09/airdate-sleepy-hollow.html|title=Airdate: Sleepy Hollow|work=TV Tonight|last=Knox|first=David|date=September 5, 2013|accessdate=September 14, 2013}} The series was moved to [[Eleven (TV channel)|Eleven]] on January 13, 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.tvtonight.com.au/2013/12/returning-sleepy-hollow-2.html|title=Returning: Sleepy Hollow|last=Knox|first=David|work=TV Tonight|date=December 31, 2013|accessdate=December 31, 2013}} In the United Kingdom and [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]], the series was acquired by the [[Universal Channel (UK and Ireland)|Universal Channel]],{{cite web |title=Universal Channel Acquires UK Rights To Fox's 'Sleepy Hollow'|url=http://www.tvwise.co.uk/2013/09/universal-channel-acquires-uk-rights-to-foxs-sleepy-hollow/|first=Patrick|last=Munn|work=TVWise|date=September 5, 2013|accessdate=September 11, 2013}} which premiered it on October 9, 2013.{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/ustv/news/a515898/sleepy-hollow-tv-series-to-premiere-in-the-uk-next-month.html#~p3ybQCRhYGbvUT|title='Sleepy Hollow' TV series to premiere in the UK next month|last=Rigby|first=Sam|date=September 16, 2013|work=Digital Spy|publisher=Hearst Magazines|accessdate=February 6, 2015}} The second season debuted on October 15, 2014{{cite web|url=http://www.tvwise.co.uk/2014/09/universal-channel-sets-uk-premiere-date-sleepy-hollow-season-2/|title=Universal Channel Sets UK Premiere Date For 'Sleepy Hollow' Season 2|author=The TVWise Team|work=TV Wise|date=September 4, 2014|accessdate=February 6, 2015}} and the third season debuted on October 22, 2015. Season 4 premiere on Syfy February 22, 2017. In [[South Africa]], the second season began airing on [[M-Net|M-Net Edge]] alongside the network's launch on October 20, 2014.{{cite web|url=http://dstvmediasales.com/its-raining-stunning-series-m-net-edge-is-launching-next-week/|title=It's raining stunning series – M-Net Edge is launching next week!|work=DSTV Media Sales|publisher=Multichoice|accessdate=February 6, 2015}} In [[Thailand]], the series aired on [[Channel 3 (Thailand)|Channel 3]] every Thursday night starting November 26, 2015.{{cite web|language=Thai|url=http://drama.kapook.com/view135103.html|title=ช่อง 3 ส่ง Sleepy Hollow ผีหัวขาดล่าหัวคน ลงจอ|date=November 24, 2015|accessdate=December 5, 2015|website=Kapook.com}} ==Reception== ''Sleepy Hollow'' has received generally favorable reviews from critics. On [[Rotten Tomatoes]], the first season holds a rating of 77%, based on 44 reviews, with an average rating of 6.6/10. The site's critical consensus reads, "Despite its overstuffed plot, ''Sleepy Hollow'' is a fun romp with exciting action scenes and sparkling production values."{{cite web|url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/tv/sleepy-hollow/s01/|title=Sleepy Hollow: Season 1|date=16 September 2013|work=rottentomatoes.com}} On [[Metacritic]] the first season has a score of 64 out of 100, based on 29 critics, indicating "generally favorable reviews".{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/tv/sleepy-hollow |title= Sleepy Hollow : Season 1 | publisher= [[CBS Interactive]] |work= [[Metacritic]] |accessdate= January 5, 2015}} Verne Gay of ''[[Newsday]]'' commented that although there is "nothing scary here", the show is "fun enough".{{cite web |url=http://www.newsday.com/entertainment/tv/sleepy-hollow-review-fantasy-horror-1.6069094 | title='Sleepy Hollow' review: Fantasy horror | publisher=Newsday | date=September 13, 2013 | accessdate=September 27, 2013}} Robert Bianco of ''[[USA Today]]'' gave the show 3 out of 4 stars.{{cite web |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/tv/2013/09/15/robert-bianco-sleepy-hollow-fox-review/2800529/ | title=For 'Sleepy Hollow,' fun can keep snores away | publisher=USA Today | date=September 15, 2013 | accessdate=September 27, 2013}} ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'', which originally doubted the premise of the show, gave the show a B+ after seeing the first half of the first season, citing the Crane & Mills' chemistry and the show's surprisingly fun mythology.{{citation |url=http://insidetv.ew.com/2013/12/04/crazy-ones-mom-sleepy-hollow-second-chance-reviews/ | title=Capsule TV Reviews: Give These Shows a Second Chance | date=December 4, 2013 | accessdate= December 5, 2013 | work=EW.com}} ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' called ''Sleepy Hollow'' one of 2013's Ten Best new shows.{{citation |url=http://entertainment.time.com/2013/12/05/the-best-new-tv-shows-of-2013/ | title=The Best New TV Shows of 2013 | first=James |last=Poniewozik | journal=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] | date=December 5, 2013 | accessdate=December 9, 2013}} The series premiered on September 16, 2013 to 10 million viewers with 3.5 rating/9 share which was double the amount that Fox's ''[[The Mob Doctor]]'' brought in at the same time last year and marked the network's highest rated fall drama premiere since the 2006 police drama ''[[Standoff (TV series)|Standoff]]''.{{cite web|author=Cynthia Littleton Editor-in-chief: TV @Variety_Cynthia |url=https://variety.com/2013/tv/news/cbs-under-the-dome-goes-out-strong-foxs-sleepy-hollow-solid-in-debut-1200614910/ |title=CBS' 'Under the Dome' Goes Out Strong; Fox's 'Sleepy Hollow' Impresses in Debut |publisher=Variety |date=September 17, 2013 |accessdate=September 22, 2013}} In Australia the first episode had 597,000 viewers{{cite web|url=http://www.tvtonight.com.au/2013/09/tuesday-17-september-2013.html|title=Tuesday 17 September 2013|work=tvtonight.com.au|accessdate=January 11, 2014}} and in the United Kingdom the same episode had 527,000 viewers.{{cite web|url=http://www.barb.co.uk/viewing/weekly-top-10?|title=Top 10 7-13 October 2013|work=barb.co.uk}} In the real [[Sleepy Hollow, New York]], the local newspaper has regularly enumerated the many fanciful fictions told about the village, including its labyrinth of Revolutionary-era tunnels and a vast increase in population (from an actual 2010 census of 9,870 to roughly 144,000 reported in the show).{{Cite journal |last=Neilsen |first=David |date=24 January 2014 |title=What TV Has Taught Me About Sleepy Hollow |journal=River Journal |volume=16 |issue=1 |page=1 |location=Tarrytown, NY |publisher=River Journal Inc. |accessdate=9 February 2014 |url=http://www.riverjournalonline.com/villages/sleepyhollow/3131-what-tv-has-taught-me-about-sleepy-hollow.html }} Season 2 was met with more favorable reviews, holding a rating of 100% on Rotten Tomatoes. The consensus reads, "''Sleepy Hollow'' continues to pack a punch in its sophomore season, with fantastic writing and lots of chills."{{cite web|url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/tv/sleepy-hollow/s02/|title=Sleepy Hollow: Season 2|date=22 September 2014|work=rottentomatoes.com}} ===Ratings=== {{Television season ratings | hide_18_49_rating {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2015}} {{Use British English|date=August 2015}} [[File:Slub live Roebuck.jpg|thumb|Dave and Alex of Slub performing live in London. The left screen shows one performer's [[Command-line interface|CLI]], the right shows the other performer's "Scheme bricks" coding interface, and the top shows a custom-made game environment through which audience members influence the music generation.]] '''Slub''' is an [[algorave]] group formed in 2000 by [[Adrian Ward (artist)|Adrian Ward]] and [[Alex McLean]], joined by Dave Griffiths in 2005 and [[Alexandra Cardenas]] in 2017. They are known for making their music exclusively from their own [[generative music|generative]] software, projecting their screens so their audience can see their handmade interfaces.<ref> {{Citation | last = Shulgin | first = Alexei | title = | place = Helsinki | publisher = NIFCA | year = 2003 | chapter = Listen to the Tools | chapterurl = http://www.m-cult.org/read_me/text/alex_ade.htm | url = http://www.m-cult.org/read_me/reader.php | isbn = 951-8955-74-3}}</ref> Their music is improvised, and advertised as falling within the ambient gabba genre.<ref> {{Cite web | title = Slub performance | year = 2009 | url = http://www.takeawayfestival.com/Performances/SLUB | accessdate = 22 April 2010}} </ref><ref>[http://www.kwadratuur.be/interviews/detail/slub-trio/ Slub-trio, Muziek moet het visuele volgen, niet omgekeerd] (dutch interview)</ref>
Since 2005 slub performances have been exclusively [[live coding|live coded]], using a variety of different self-built language environments.<ref>{{Cite web | last = Armitage | first = Tom | title = Slub: Making music with live computer code | publisher = Wired Magazine | date = 24 September 2009 | url = https://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2009-09/25/making-music-with-live-computer-code-.aspx | accessdate = 22 April 2010}}</ref> These have included Pure Events, a [[Tracker (music software)|tracker]]-like [[JavaScript]] environment; feedback.pl, an environment for self-editing [[Perl]] programming;<ref>{{Cite web | last = McLean | first = Alex | title = Hacking Perl in Nightclubs | publisher = O'Reilly | date = 31 August 2004 | url = http://www.perl.com/pub/a/2004/08/31/livecode.html | accessdate = 22 April 2010}}</ref> [[Fluxus (programming environment)|Fluxus]], a [[Scheme (programming language)|Scheme]] game engine; and [http://yaxu.org/tidal/ Tidal], a pure functional [[Domain-specific language|DSL]] embedded in [[Haskell (programming language)|Haskell]].
In 2011, while on the way to a gig, Alex McLean and [[Nick Collins (composer)|Nick Collins]] invented the [[Algorave]].<ref>{{Cite web | last = Cheshire |first = Tom |title = Hacking meets clubbing with the 'algorave' | publisher = Wired Magazine | date = 29 August 2013 | url = https://www.wired.co.uk/magazine/archive/2013/09/play/algorave | accessdate = 29 August 2013}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://slub.org/ slub official homepage]

{{globalize/US|date=October 2014}} '''Structuring''', also known as '''smurfing''' in [[banking industry|banking]] [[jargon]], is the practice of executing [[financial transaction]]s such as making bank deposits in a specific pattern, calculated to avoid triggering [[financial institution]]s to file reports required by law, such as the United States' [[Bank Secrecy Act]] (BSA) and [[Internal Revenue Code]] section 6050I (relating to the requirement to file Form 8300). Structuring may be done in the context of [[money laundering]], [[fraud]], and other [[financial crime]]s. Legal restrictions on structuring are concerned with limiting the size of domestic transactions for individuals. ==Definition== Structuring is the act of parceling what would otherwise be a large financial transaction into a series of smaller transactions to avoid scrutiny by regulators and law enforcement.{{cite journal|last1=Linn|first1=Courtney J.|title=Redefining the Bank Secrecy Act: Currency Reporting and the Crime of Structuring|journal=Santa Clara Law Review|date=2010|volume=50|issue=2|pages=407–513|url=http://digitalcommons.law.scu.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1058&context=lawreview}} Typically each of the smaller transactions is executed in an amount below some statutory limit that normally does not require a [[financial institution]] to file a report with a government agency. Criminal enterprises may employ several [[agent (law)|agents]] ("smurfs") to make the transaction.{{cn|date=March 2017}} Structuring appears in federal indictments related to [[money laundering]], [[fraud]], and other [[financial crime]]s. The term "smurfing" is derived from the image of the comic book characters, [[the Smurfs]], having a large group of many small entities. Miami-based lawyer Gregory Baldwin is said to have coined the term in the 1980s.{{cite news | author1=Gross, Samantha | author2=Barrett, Devlin | title=Spitzer Tripped Up on Laws He Enforced | url=http://www.foxnews.com/wires/2008Mar11/0,4670,SpitzerTheMoneyTrail,00.html | work=Fox News | date=11 March 2008 | accessdate=2008-03-14 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080322064115/http://www.foxnews.com/wires/2008Mar11/0,4670,SpitzerTheMoneyTrail,00.html | archivedate=22 March 2008 | df=dmy-all }} ==Regulations== Legal restrictions on structuring are concerned with limiting the size of domestic transactions for individuals, and somewhat limiting the outbound foreign currency transfers of firms or company entities.{{cn|date=March 2008}} This should not be confused with [[capital controls]], which are regulatory limits on the money that one can take out of a nation and generally regulate how much money can leave a country at any given time.{{cn|date=March 2017}} Both can have some of the same economic effects in some economies, as structuring controls effectively limit the flow of capital by magnitude and duration, and can apply equally to taking money out of a nation as well as putting money into its financial system.{{cn|date=March 2017}} ===United States=== In the [[United States]], the [[Bank Secrecy Act]] requires [[currency transaction report]]s (CTRs) to be filed for transactions valued at more than $10,000; it applies to both U.S. and foreign currencies.See generally {{usc|31|5313}}, {{usc|31|5324}}, 31 C.F.R. sec. 1010.311, and 31 C.F.R. sec. 1010.314. Financial institutions suspecting deposit structuring with intent to avoid the law are required to file a [[suspicious activity report]] (SAR).See generally 31 C.F.R. sec. 1010.320. In 1986, the [[U.S. Congress]] enacted section 5324 of Title 31 of the [[United States Code]],See section 1354(a) of the Anti-Drug Abuse Act of 1986, Public Law No. 99-570, 100 Stat. 3207, at 3207-22 (27 Oct. 1986). which provides (in part):
No person shall, for the purpose of evading the reporting requirements of section 5313 (a) or 5325 or any regulation prescribed under any such section, the reporting or record keeping requirements imposed by any order issued under section 5326, or the record keeping requirements imposed by any regulation prescribed under section 21 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act or section 123 of Public Law 91–508—[...] (3) structure or assist in structuring, or attempt to structure or assist in structuring, any transaction with one or more domestic financial institutions.
Section 5324 further provides that a violation of this provision may be punished by a fine or up to five years in prison, or both.See 31 USC section 5324(d)(1). The filing of Form 8300 is required under [[Internal Revenue Code]] section 6050I.{{cite book | author=Internal Revenue Service | chapter=Part IV Examining Process; Chapter 26 Bank Secrecy Act; Section 13 Structuring | title=Internal Revenue Manual | location=Washington, D.C. | publisher=US Treasury Department | url=https://www.irs.gov/irm/index.html | chapterurl=https://www.irs.gov/irm/part4/ch25s17.html | date=2006-06-01 | oclc=37305546 | accessdate=2008-03-11}} Sums of money resulting from deposits of less than $10,000 may be seized after a warrant is issued based on a [[suspicious activity report]]. Legal proceedings, which may cost in the vicinity of $20,000 or more, may be required for an innocent party to retrieve his or her money. Reports in October 2014 by ''[[The New York Times]]'' of arbitrary seizures resulted in modification of [[Internal Revenue Service]] (IRS) practice to focus on investigations that "closely align" with IRS "mission and key priorities". Banks are not permitted to warn or advise customers unless the customer asks, but sometimes bank tellers will informally warn customers.[https://www.nytimes.com/2014/10/26/us/law-lets-irs-seize-accounts-on-suspicion-no-crime-required.html "Law Lets I.R.S. Seize Accounts on Suspicion, No Crime Required"] article by Sahaila Dewan in ''[[The New York Times]]'' 25 October 2014 ===Outside the United States=== {| class="wikitable" ! width="120" | Jurisdiction ! width="100" | Single transaction ! Notes |- | [[Australia]] | [[Australian Dollar|AU$]]10,000 | Although there are no weekly or monthly limits, any parceling to evade the rules is a criminal offence.{{cite web | author=[[Australian Transaction Reports and Analysis Centre]] | title=AUSTRAC Guideline No. 1: Suspect Transaction Reporting | url=http://www.austrac.gov.au/sites/default/files/documents/guideline_1_archived.pdf | format=.PDF | work=Financial Transaction Reports Act 1988 | publisher=Government of Australia |date=September 2002| accessdate=2008-03-12}} |- | [[Brazil]] | ''varies'' | Depends on transaction type.{{cite web | author=Conselho de Controle de Atividades Financeiras | title=Lavagem de Dinheiro | url=http://www.coaf.fazenda.gov.br/conteudo/publicacoes | publisher=Ministério da Fazenda | language=Portuguese | accessdate=2008-03-12 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070703151241/http://www.coaf.fazenda.gov.br/conteudo/publicacoes | archivedate=3 July 2007 | df=dmy-all }} |- | [[Canada]] | [[Canadian dollar|CA$]]10,000 | All transactions totaling CA$10,000 within a 24-hour period are subject to reporting. Certain businesses may qualify for Alternative to Large Cash Transaction (ALCT) reporting.{{cite web|url=http://www.fintrac.gc.ca/publications/guide/Guide9/9-eng.asp|title=Guideline 9: Alternative to Large Cash Transaction Reports to FINTRAC|work=fintrac.gc.ca}} |- | [[Fiji]] | [[Fijian dollar|FJ$]]1,100 | Individuals are subject to FJ$7,700 in a given week. Businesses engaged as investor tourism operators have no limit.{{cn|date=March 2008}} |- | [[France]] | [[Euro|€]]1,000 | For French residents, starting from September 2015.{{cn|date=March 2017}} |- | [[Germany]] | €10,000 |{{cn|date=July 2017}} |- | [[Guyana]] | [[United States Dollar|US$]]10,000 |{{cn|date=March 2017}} |- | [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]] | €10,000 |Per the 4th EU Anti-Money Laundering Directive (2017)http://www.antimoneylaundering.gov.ie/website/aml/amlcuweb.nsf/0/B75E0654ED35762480257F230043F9FE/$File/2014%20Report.pdf |- | [[India]] | [[Rupee|₹]] 50,000 |{{cn|date=March 2017}} |- | [[Italy]] | €12,500 | {{cite web | author=Dipartimento del Tesoro | title=Antiriciclaggio | url=http://www.dt.tesoro.it/Aree-Docum/Prevenzion/Antiriciclaggio/index.htm | publisher=Ministero dell'Economia e delle Finanze | language=Italian | accessdate=2008-03-12 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080315134134/http://www.dt.tesoro.it/Aree-Docum/Prevenzion/Antiriciclaggio/index.htm | archivedate=15 March 2008 | df=dmy-all }} |- | [[Lithuania]] | [[Lithuanian litas|LTL]]10,000 |{{cn|date=March 2017}} |- | [[Netherlands]] | €15,000 | {{cite web | author=FIU-Nederland | title=Meldingen Ongebruikelijke Transacties | url=http://www.justitie.nl/mot/ | publisher=Ministerie van Justitie | language= Dutch | accessdate=2008-03-12}} |- | [[New Zealand]] | [[New Zealand Dollar|NZ$]]10,000 | Not applicable to the [[Cook Islands]]{{cn|date=March 2017}} |- | [[Philippines]] | [[Philippine peso|PHP]]500,000 |{{cn|date=March 2017}} |- | [[Portugal]] | €10,000 | |- | [[Romania]] | €10,000 |{{cn|date=March 2017}} |- | [[Spain]] | €3,000 |{{cn|date=March 2017}} |- | [[Sweden]] | €10,000 | {{cite web |author1=Europa Taxation |author2=Customs Union |lastauthoramp=yes | title=Cash controls | url=http://ec.europa.eu/taxation_customs/customs/customs_controls/cash_controls/index_en.htm | publisher=European Commission | date=21 December 2007 | accessdate=2008-03-12}} |- | [[Thailand]] | US$58,000 | {{cite web | author=Netipoom Maysakun| title=MONEY LAUNDERING IN THAILAND | url=http://www.unafei.or.jp/english/pdf/PDF_rms/no73/12_p86-p94.pdf |format=PDF| publisher=The United Nations Asia and Far East Institute for the Prevention of Crime and the Treatment of Offenders | date= | accessdate=2008-09-15}} |- | [[Turkey]] | US$50,000 |{{cn|date=March 2017}} |} * Fiji has its own anti-structuring laws, but they should not be confused with Fiji's [[capital control]]s. Fiji has limited outbound withdrawals in hard currency (AUD, NZD, USD) for at least 20 years.{{cn|date=March 2017}} * The Cook Islands has "Home Rule" with respect to banking. Cook Islands [[automated teller machine]]s often fail to fully disclose the fact that the Cooks have their own structuring regulations and are not part of the New Zealand banking system.{{cn|date=March 2017}} ==Other uses== The term "smurfing" is also applied to activity associated with [[controlled substance]]s such as [[pseudoephedrine]].{{cite web |url=http://www.justice.gov/dea/concern/18862/ndic_2009.pdf |format=PDF |title=DEA |page=16 |publisher=Justice.gov |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101017093604/http://www.justice.gov/dea/concern/18862/ndic_2009.pdf |archivedate=17 October 2010 |df=dmy-all }} In this context the agent will make purchases of small, legal amounts from several drug and grocery stores, with the intent to aggregate the lot for use in the illegal production of [[methamphetamine]]. Also, since the monthly [[pseudoephedrine]] purchase limits in US are too low for mass meth production, this practice often involves using multiple "smurfs". As Robert Pennal of the Fresno Meth Task Force explains:
Then we started seeing "smurfing." Remember how the smurfs were little gatherers? We started getting calls from different retail stores that people were buying two or three packs — that's the most you can buy — and they went to one store, they bought three, they went to another store, bought three. We're seeing [[blister packs]] everywhere because they're sitting in the car, they're punching the pills out of the blister packs, they're putting them in the freezer bags and they're turning them over to chemical brokers.{{cite web|url=https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/pages/frontline/meth/etc/script.html|title=Transcript - The Meth Epidemic - FRONTLINE - PBS|work=FRONTLINE}}
==See also== *[[Bank Secrecy Act]] *[[Salami slicing]] *[[Structured finance]] *[[Kent_Hovind#Federal_criminal_tax-related_trial_and_convictions_in_2006|Kent Hovind]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20060319192030/http://www.fincen.gov/fincenruling2005-6.pdf Financial Crimes Enforcement Network ruling on structuring] {{Bank regulation in the United States}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2010}} [[Category:Banking terms]] [[Category:Commercial crimes]] [[Category:Money laundering]] [[Category:Tax evasion]] [[Category:Civil asset forfeiture]] [[fr:Blanchiment d'argent#Méthodes de blanchiment]]

revision.comment: removed [[Category:Siena]]; added [[Category:Buildings and structures in Siena]] using [[WP:HC|HotCat]]
revision.text:
[[File:Siena, p. indipendenza, teatro dei rozzi.JPG|230px|thumb|Teatro dei rozzi]] The '''Teatro dei Rozzi''' is a live-performance theater located on Piazza Indipendenza #15, in the city of [[Siena]], region of [[Tuscany]], Italy; while this structure was inaugurated in 1817, the sponsoring organization dated to 1531.
==History== In 1531, a group of artisans created the ''Congregation of Rozzi'' dedicated to mainly oral performances of secular poetry, often during festivals. At this "academy", intellectuals and literati of the town attempted to refine the more popular forms of theater into more sophisticated art. By some it was called the ''Academy of the Uncouth'' for its avoidance of Latin texts.<ref>[https://books.google.com/books?id=3uq0bObScHMC Cambridge History of Italian Literature], by Peter Brand and Lino Pertile, page 230.</ref> The group took on an emblem and symbol, the cork tree which draws from the ground. It is said among those attending performances were [[Pope Leo X]] and [[Holy Roman Emperor Charles V]].<ref>[http://siusa.archivi.beniculturali.it/cgi-bin/pagina.pl?TipoPag=cons&Chiave=2845 Siena Archives of Beni Culturali], curated entry by Barbara Maria Affolter (2006) with a bibliography including: 1) M. Marcucci, N. Crevani, Accademie e istituzioni culturali in Toscana, Firenze 1988, 447-453; 2) "L'archivio dell'Accademia [dei Rozzi]. Inventario", a cura di M. De Gregori, Siena 1999, and 3) R. Alonge, "Il Teatro dei Rozzi di Siena", Firenze 1967.</ref>
[[File:Portale Teatro dei Rozzi Siena.JPG|thumb|left|The gate of the theatre with Rozzi's coat of arms]] During the middle decades of the 17th century, the Rozzi specialized in readings of pastoral drama, while later in the 17th century, it was occupied with the satirical comedies by [[Girolamo Gigli]] (1660-1722) and the comedies of character by [[Jacopo Angelo Nelli]] (1673-1767), and works of [[Pietro Fortini]].<ref>Brand and Pertile, page 327.</ref>
The congregation was transformed into the ''Academy of the Rozzi'' in 1690, to which Francesco de' Medici, granted use of rooms in the [[Palazzo Pubblico of Siena]]. During the 18th and 19th centuries it became a more prestigious cultural institution in town, fostering a number of dramatists, including [[Benvenuto Flori]], [[Agostino Gallini]], and [[Girolamo Ronconi]].
The Accademia dei Rozzi established to build a theater in 1807, designed by [[Alessandro Doveri]]. The project was forsaken because it took from the Academies meeting rooms. A new locale, the present one, was obtained leading to construction of this theater in 1815 by the same architect using a different design. The Theater hall was inaugurated in 1817, with the musical play ''L'Agnese di Fitzenry'' by [[Ferdinando Paer]].
In 1873, the architect Corbi remodeled the theater, which remained open until 1945, when damage from the Second World War caused it to close. It was later refurbished again and reopened to the public in 1998, as a theater with 499 seats, three rows of boxes and a gallery open houses and theatrical activities, music and conferences.<ref>[http://www.comune.siena.it/La-Citta/Cultura/Teatri/TEATRO-DEI-ROZZI/LA-STORIA Comune of Siena], history of Teatro dei Rozzi.</ref><ref>[https://books.google.com/books?id=1c1iAAAAcAAJ Cenni storico-artistici di Siena e suoi suburbii], Ettore Romaganoli, 1840, page 54.</ref> The ''Accademia dei 'Rozzi''' still maintains a library and archive of it past works and functions.<ref>Barbara Maria Affolter (2006).</ref>
==References== {{reflist}} {{coord|43|19|08.7|N|11|19|49.2|E|region:IT_type:landmark_source:dewiki|display=title}}
== External links == {{official|http://www.accademiadeirozzi.it/}}
[[Category:Theatres in Tuscany]] [[Category:Theatres completed in 1817]] [[Category:1513 establishments in Italy]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Siena]]

{{Infobox television | show_name = The Chairman's Ear | image = | caption = | show_name_2 = | genre = [[Political satire]] | creator = Robert Górski | director = | developer = | presenter = | starring = | voices = | narrated = | theme_music_composer = | opentheme = | endtheme = | country = [[Poland]] | language = [[Polish language|Polish]] | num_seasons = 4 | num_episodes = 45 | list_episodes = | executive_producer = Robert Górski | producer = Robert Górski
Mikołaj Cieślak
[[Izabela Dąbrowska]] | supervising_producer = | asst_producer = | editor = | writer = [[Robert Górski]]
[[Mikołaj Cieślak]] | location = [[Warsaw]], Poland | camera = Multi-camera | runtime = Varies from 9 to 17 minutes | network = {{Plainlist| * [[YouTube]] * [[Showmax]] * [[Wirtualna Polska|WP]] }} | picture_format = | audio_format = | first_run = | first_aired = {{Start date|2017|01|09}} | last_aired = | preceded_by = | followed_by = | related = | website = https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCggq3qvOrrM2u9gRL7oMOfA }} '''''The Chairman's Ear''''' ([[Polish language|Polish]]: ''Ucho Prezesa'') is a [[Poland|Polish]] [[political satire]] [[web series]] broadcast since 9 January 2017 on [[YouTube]], and since 15 February 2017 on [[Showmax]].{{cite web |url=http://www.wirtualnemedia.pl/artykul/nowe-odcinki-ucho-prezesa-showmax-youtube |title=Nowe odcinki Ucho Prezesa ShowMax YouTube |publisher=Wirtualnemedia.pl |date=2017-02-15 |accessdate=2017-03-21 |language=Polish}} It is created by Robert Górski, the lead member of the ''Kabaret Moralnego Niepokoju''.{{cite web |url=http://www.wirtualnemedia.pl/artykul/ucho-prezesa-kabaret-moralnego-niepokoju-przygotowuje-internetowy-serial-satyryczny-wideo |title=Ucho Prezesa - Kabaret Moralnego Niepokoju przygotowuje internetowy serial satyryczny (wideo) |publisher=Wirtualnemedia.pl |date=2017-01-03 |accessdate=2017-03-21 |language=Polish}} == Plot == The series follows the chairman of the ruling political party in Poland (Mr Chairman). The narrative takes place primarily in his office where, joined by his assistant Mariusz, he hosts numerous visitors, including government officials and other public office holders. While Mr Chairman does not hold any elected office himself, it is clear that key political decisions are made in this office, and not in the [[Chancellery of the Prime Minister of Poland|Chancellery of the Prime Minister]] (who herself frequents the office). The plot is deeply rooted in contemporary Polish politics, with each character having a real-life counterpart, with whom they share first names (their surnames are never revealed). The titular character of Mr Chairman is based on [[Jarosław Kaczyński]], the leader of the governing [[Law and Justice]] party. ''The Chairman's Ear'' is a continuation of a series of cabaret scenes named ''Government meeting'' (Polish: ''Posiedzenie rządu'') in which Robert Górski and other cabaret artists impersonated the members of the [[Civic Platform]] and the [[Polish People's Party]]. ==Cast== {| class="wikitable" !Actor !Character !Episodes !Archetype{{cite web |url=http://www.polityka.pl/tygodnikpolityka/kultura/1690020,1,ucho-prezesa-parodiuje-pis-i-kaczynskiego-niestety-wladza-sama-dostarcza-wiekszej-rozrywki.read |title = „Ucho prezesa” parodiuje PiS i Kaczyńskiego. Niestety władza sama dostarcza większej rozrywki |publisher = Polityka |language = pl}} |- | [[Robert Górski]] | Jarosław, Mr Chairman | since 1 | [[Jarosław Kaczyński]], chairman of the [[Law and Justice]] party |- | [[Mikołaj Cieślak]] | Mariusz | since 1 | [[Mariusz Błaszczak]], minister of the interior |- | [[Izabela Dąbrowska]] | Basia, secretary | since 1 | Barbara Skrzypek |- | [[Paweł Koślik]] | Andrzej, president of Poland (often called Adrian by other characters) | since 3 | [[Andrzej Duda]] |- | [[Michał Czernecki]] | Jacek | 2, 5, 14 | [[Jacek Kurski]], chairman of the public television ([[Telewizja Polska|TVP]]) |- | [[Robert Majewski (actor)|Robert Majewski]] | | 2 | [[Krzysztof Czabański]], head of the National Media Council |- | [[Wojciech Kalarus]] | Antoni, minister of war | 3, 9 | [[Antoni Macierewicz]], minister of national defence |- | [[Grzegorz Ciągardlak]] | Misio, Antoni's assistant | 3, 9 | [[Bartłomiej Misiewicz]] |- | [[Sebastian Stankiewicz]] | Tomasz, Basia's son | 4, 10, 12 | Marcin Skrzypek |- | [[Sebastian Konrad]] | Mateusz | 4 | [[Mateusz Morawiecki]], deputy prime minister |- | [[Katarzyna Żak]] | Jola, nurse | 5, 14 | [[Jolanta Szczypińska]] |- | [[Agnieszka Wosińska]] | Beata | 5, 14 | [[Beata Mazurek]], spokesman for the Law and Justice party |- | [[Adam Krawczuk]] | Adam, [[public relations|PR]] specialist | 5 | [[Adam Bielan]] |- | [[Magdalena Smalara]] | Ania | 6 | [[Anna E. {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2015}} {{Infobox book | italic title = <!--(see above)--> | name = | image = Hound-of-Florence-1930.jpg | image_size = | alt = | caption = Cover of the American edition. | author = [[Felix Salten]] | audio_read_by = | title_orig = Der Hund von Florenz | orig_lang_code = | title_working = | translator = Huntley Paterson | illustrator = [[Kurt Wiese]] | cover_artist = | country = [[Austria]] | language = German | series = | release_number = | subject = | genre = novel | set_in = | published = | publisher = Simon and Schuster | publisher2 = | pub_date = 1923 | english_pub_date = 1930 | media_type = | pages = 237 | awards = | isbn = | isbn_note = | oclc = 1826868 | dewey = | congress = | preceded_by = | followed_by = | native_wikisource = | wikisource = | notes = | exclude_cover = | website = }} '''''The Hound of Florence: A Novel''''' ({{lang-de|link=no|Der Hund von Florenz}}) is a 1923 novel written by [[Felix Salten]]. It is best known today for partly inspiring (and even mentioned in) the 1959 [[Walt Disney Pictures]] film, ''[[The Shaggy Dog (1959 film)|The Shaggy Dog]]'', as well as a sequel and remakes. The novel was first translated into English in 1930 by [[Huntley Paterson]], and the translation has illustrations by [[Kurt Wiese]].
''The Hound of Florence'' is an adventure story for young readers, set in early eighteenth-century [[Austria]] and Italy. The adolescent Lukas Grassi has lost his parents and lives in [[Vienna]] in great poverty, longs for his native Italy, and would like to study art in [[Florence]]. By magic, his wish is granted, but every other day he must take the form of a dog, Kambyses,<ref>In the English translation, the names are spelled "Lucas Grassi" and "Cambyses."</ref> that belongs to the Archduke Ludwig; and alternating daily between human and canine form, he travels from Vienna to Florence along with the Archduke's troops, and there has to lead a unique double life. This is the only book of Salten in which [[supernatural]] elements occur, and they may show influence of [[E. T. A. Hoffmann]].<ref>{{cite book | last=Ehness | first=Jürgen | title=Felix Saltens erzählerisches Werk: Beschreibung und Deutung | location=Frankfurt am Main | publisher=Peter Lang | date=2002 | isbn=3-631-38178-6 | page=221 | language=German }}</ref>
The book has some "overtly" autobiographical background. In 1890s the journalist Salten had become a friend and confidant of the Austrian archduke [[Archduke Leopold Ferdinand of Austria|Leopold Ferdinand]], and in his novel, Salten makes use of his experiences with the archduke and his brothers. He carried the material for twenty-five years before he dared to write the story. In 1907 he mentioned [[Arthur Schnitzler]] that he was then about to finish the manuscript. However it was not until 1921 when the manuscript was completed.<ref>{{cite book |last=Eddy |first=Beverley Driver |date=2010 |title=Felix Salten: Man of Many Faces |location=Riverside (Ca.) |publisher=Ariadne Press |pages=33, 87–89, 131, 195–196, 204–205 |isbn=978-1-57241-169-2}}</ref>
Certain recurring motifs in Saltens œuvre appear also in this book: the deep cleavage between the very rich and the very poor, and the critique of the [[nobility]].<ref>Ehness (2002), p. 219.</ref>
According to Salten's biographer Beverley Driver Eddy, the strength of ''The Hound of Florence'' lies in the depiction of the dog Kambyses – a "brilliant portrayal of a dog's character."<ref>Eddy (2010), p. 195.</ref> Salten himself was a passionate dog lover and kept dogs most of his life.<ref>Eddy (2010), p. 33.</ref>
''The Hound of Florence'' is written as one piece. There are no chapter divisions. The 1920s German-language editions, set in [[Fraktur]], however use an embellished dash to divide the text into large sections,<ref>{{cite book | last=Salten | first=Felix | title=Der Hund von Florenz | location=Wien | publisher=Herz-Verlag | date=1923 }}</ref> and a 1980s edition uses [[asterisk]]s for that purpose.<ref>{{cite book | last=Salten | first=Felix | title=Der Hund von Florenz | location=Stuttgart | publisher=Klett-Cotta | isbn=3-608-95400-7 | series=Cotta's Bibliothek der Moderne, 42 | year=1985 }}</ref>
The ending of the book differs greatly in the original language and in the English translation. The German-language version ends in [[tragedy]]: the archduke stabs the dog to death, killing Lukas, and his body is disposed of. In the English translation, a wholly new ending of six more pages<ref>From page 230 on, the English translation diverts from and expands the German text.</ref> has been written: Lukas survives, gets medication and is united with the [[courtesan]]. Currently it is not known if the alternate ending is authorized.
The English-language edition of ''The Hound of Florence'' was out of print for a long time. Only 2014 was a new edition published, this time illustrated by [[Richard Cowdrey]], using the alternate ending.<ref>{{cite book | last=Salten | first=Felix | title=The Hound of Florence | location=New York | publisher=Aladdin | year=2014 | isbn=978-1-4424-8749-9 | others=Illustrated by Richard Cowdrey }}</ref> The novel was translated into [[French language|French]] in 1952.<ref>{{cite book | last=Salten | first=Felix | title=Le chien de Florence | location=Bruxelles | publisher=Éditions de la Paix | year=1952 | others=Traduit de l’allemand par Maurice Muller-Straus | language=French }}</ref> The [[Finnish language|Finnish-language]] edition from 2016 includes both endings.<ref>{{cite book | last=Salten | first=Felix | title=Koiramme Firenzessä | location=Helsinki | publisher=Books on Demand GmbH | date=2016 | isbn=978-952-330-150-4 | language=Finnish | translator=Markus Lång }}</ref>
==References== [[File:Der-Hund-von-Florenz-1923.jpg|thumb|right|German-language edition from 1923.]] <references />
{{The Hound of Florence}} {{Felix Salten}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Hound of Florence, The}} [[Category:Novels by Felix Salten]] [[Category:1923 German language novels]] [[Category:Austrian novels]] [[Category:Austrian novels adapted into films]] [[Category:Anthropomorphic dogs]] [[Category:Fictional shapeshifters]] [[Category:Novels set in the 18th century]] [[Category:Novels set in Vienna]] [[Category:Novels set in Florence]] [[Category:Fiction with alternate endings]] [[Category:Novels about dogs]]

page.title: The Twelve Dreams of the Sun

revision.text:
<!--[[Image:JMJ12dots.jpg|right|thumb|The Twelve Dreams of the Sun]]--> '''The Twelve Dreams Of The Sun''' was a concert held by musician [[Jean Michel Jarre]] on the Pyramids of [[Giza]], [[Egypt]] starting on December 31, 1999 and carrying overnight to January 1, 2000. It was attended by 120,000 people. The concert consisted of two parts, the Main Concert and a Sunrise Concert. The concert cost approximately $9,500,000 and it originated when Jean-Michel Jarre was contacted by the Egyptian president [[Hosni Mubarak]] with a special project to celebrate the dawn of the new Millennium at the foot of the only remaining monument of the original 7 Wonders of the World - the Great Pyramids.
Jarre's team had developed giant projections to be displayed on the faces of the Great Pyramids, however a heavy cloud of fog made the pyramids almost invisible, so most of the projections were discarded. Parts of the concert were broadcast live on TV stations around the world.
== Track listing == '''The Main Concert''' *The Legend *Bells *Je Me Souviens *Dream 1: The Rock *Miss Moon *Oxygene 2 *Dream 2: The House *Chronologie 6 *Dream 3: The Tree *Equinoxe 7 *Magnetic Fields 2 *Dream 4: The Boat *Millions of Stars *Dream 5: The Flesh *Souvenir of China *Oxygene 10 *Dream 6: The Voice *Oum Kalsoum tribute *Dream 7: The Sky *Hey Gagarin *Dream 8: The Child - This track wasn't played due to the concert running into the time allocated for Dream 8, as not to impede the time allocated for the millennium countdown. *Gloria *Millennium Countdown *C'est La Vie *[[Salma Ya Salama]] *Dream 9: The Bell *Equinoxe 4 *Dream 10: The Snow *Oxygene 4 *Tout est Bleu *Dream 11: The Blood *Evolutions - The original track, Revolutions, had to be censored due to 'Revolution' being prohibited from being spoken of or written in Egypt. Also, the word 'Sex' is banned so the lyrics had to be altered. *Oxygene 12 *Dream 12: The Gate *Give Me A Sign *Oxygene 8 *Band in the Rain *Rendez-vous 2
'''The Sunrise Concert''' *Ethnicolor *Oxygene 7 *C'est La Vie *The Sun *Hey Gagarin *Eldorado
== The Musicians == *'''[[Jean Michel Jarre]]''' - Keyboards, Laser Harp, Vocals *'''[[Gary Wallis]]''' - Drums & Percussions *'''[[Francis Rimbert]]''' - Keyboards *'''[[Joachim Garraud]]''' - Sound design, Keyboards *'''[[Christopher Papendieck]]''' - Bass *'''[[Natacha Atlas]]''' - Vocals on 'C'est La Vie' *'''[[Laurie Anderson]]''' - Vocals on 'Je Me Souviens' and Dream introductions *'''[[Amal Maher]]''' - Vocals *'''[[Yvan Cassar]]''' - Symphonic Orchestra Musical Arrangements *'''[[Sacha Séméria]]''' - Sound Designer *'''[[Frédéric Sanchez]]''' - Sound Illustrator *'''[[Cairo Opera Symphonic Orchestra]]''' - Conducted by Dr. Moustafa Nagui *'''[[Cairo Opera House Choir]]''' - conducted by Aldo Magnato *'''[[National Arabic Ensemble]]''' - conducted by Nasredine Dalil *'''[[National Folkloric Music Troupe]]''' *'''[[El Nil Folkloric Music Troupe]]''' *'''[[Aswan Folkloric Music Troupe]]'''
== External links == *[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/middle_east/580891.stm BBC News 28.12.1999: Egyptian Court OKs Pyramid Party] *[http://equinoxejmjarre.free.fr/Albums-Concerts/1990-1999/1999-12-31_2000-01-01_Les_Douze_Reves_Du_Soleil/1999-12-32_2000-01-01_Les_Douzes_Reves_Du_Soleil-photos.html Pictures of the event]
{{Jean Michel Jarre}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Twelve Dreams of the Sun}} [[Category:Concerts]] [[Category:Giza Plateau]] [[Category:New-age music]]

revision.comment: changed capitol (building) to capital (center of government). Famous Dave's was closed, knocked down, and a new building in that spot now houses Uncle Julio's as of July or August 2018
revision.text:
{{Infobox historic site | name = Three Mile Oak | image = Three Mile Oak Tree-New.png | image_size = 250 | caption = 1967 Replacement Oak at Three Mile Oak Tree Marker | locmapin = USA Maryland | map_width = | map_caption = | coordinates = {{coord|38.986|-76.547|display=inline,title}} }}
'''Three Mile Oak''' got its name because it was three miles from the [[Maryland State House]]. Prominent visitors were met at the tree, on the outskirts of [[Annapolis, Maryland|Annapolis]], and escorted into the city.
==History== The Three Mile Oak was last a tree stump from the 18th century. Presumably a [[white oak]], about six feet in diameter, and originally located three miles from Annapolis in Parole, Anne Arundel County. The tree was struck by [[lightning]], became hollow, was killed by fire, and finally blew down on May 22, 1909. At the site where the tree stood, a delegation is reported to have met [[George Washington]] en route to [[Annapolis, Maryland]] (then the U.S. capital) to resign his commission on December 19, 1783.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://speccol.mdarchives.state.md.us/msa/speccol/catalog/cfm/dsp_number.cfm?speccol=5998|title=Three Mile Oak Collection MSA SC 5998 |publisher=Maryland State Archives|date=|accessdate=2012-09-15}}</ref> [[George Washington's resignation as commander-in-chief|Washington resigned as commander-in-chief]] on December 23.<ref name=aoc>{{cite web|title=General George Washington Resigning His Commission|url=https://www.aoc.gov/art/historic-rotunda-paintings/general-george-washington-resigning-his-commission|publisher=[[Architect of the Capitol]]}}</ref>
==Plaque at Original Tree Site== While on display outdoors for many years, the Three Mile Oak was exhibited with a plaque erected in 1967 by the Four Rivers Garden Club, Rotary of Annapolis, explaining its significance. The plaque states:<ref>{{cite web|title=Three Mile Oak|url=https://mht.maryland.gov/secure/medusa/PDF/Anne%20Arundel/AA-895.pdf|publisher=[[Maryland Historical Trust]]|date=October 13, 2014}}</ref> {{quote|Under this tree passed General George Washington December 19, 1783 on his way to Annapolis to resign his Commission as Commander-In-Chief of the Continental Armies, and it is thought that General Smallwood accompanied by General Gates and distinguished citizens of Annapolis met General Washington at this spot.
General Lafayette passed here December 17, 1824 to visit the friends of revolutionary days. }} [[File:Three-Mile-Oak-Original-Marker.png|thumb|Original plaque]] The plaque and tree trunk originally sat at the corner of West Street and Route 178 (Generals Highway). [[File:Three Mile Oak With Concrete Block.jpg|thumb|Three Mile Oak Stump with Rebar through Concrete Block]] The concrete block that held the twisted stump of the tree is still located at that spot, just outside the parking lot of Toys R Us, diagonally from the Applebee's at the Annapolis Mall. The twisted rebars rising out of the concrete block protected the rotting trunk of the tree. [[File:Original Block for Three Mile Oak.JPG|thumb|Concrete Block that held stump of Three Mile Oak]]
==Moving the Plaque== The plaque was moved in 1967 down the road, approximately 500 feet, across from the Red Lobster and the former Famous Dave's Restaurants (now Uncle Julio’s). Local citizens feared that it would be destroyed by traffic if left unprotected at the corner of West Street and Defense Highway. A new oak tree was planted close to the relocated plaque.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://annapolis.patch.com/blog_posts/blog-three-mile-oak-tree-in-parole|publisher=Annapolis Patch|date=2012-03-08|accessdate=2012-09-14|title=BLOG: Three Mile Oak Tree in Parole|author=Laura McMarlin}}</ref> A new plaque was placed over the dismounted and moved original plaque. It reads:
:This oak tree planted in 1967 perpetuates the memory of the original Three Mile Oak which stood nearby as explained in the marker below. [[File:Three Mile Oak 1976.png|thumb|Additional Plaque for Three Mile Oak]]
==External links== * [http://www.hmdb.org/marker.asp?marker=2877 The Historical Marker Database-Trunk of the Three Mile Oak]
==References== {{commons category}} {{reflist|3}}
[[Category:Maryland culture]] [[Category:Individual oak trees]] [[Category:1900s individual tree deaths]] [[Category:Individual trees in Maryland]]

{{Infobox dance |title = Vogue |image = HOT & HEAVY VOGUE COMPETITION LINCOLN CENTER 2014.webm |alt = |caption = Vogue competition at [[Lincoln Center]], 2014 |genre = [[House dance]], [[Ball Culture|Ballroom Dance]] |signature = |inventor =Disputed |year = 1980s–present |origin = [[Harlem]], [[New York (state)|New York]], United States }}
'''Vogue''', or '''voguing''', is a highly stylized, modern [[house dance]] originating in the late 1980s that evolved out of the [[Harlem]] [[ballroom scene]] of the 1960s.<ref name=":0">{{Cite book|url=https://www.worldcat.org/oclc/863223074|title=Voguing and the house ballroom scene of New York City 1989-92|last=Stuart.|first=Baker,|date=2011-01-01|isbn=9780955481765|oclc=863223074}}</ref> It gained [[mainstream]] exposure when it was featured in [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]]'s song and video "[[Vogue (Madonna song)|Vogue]]" (1990), and when showcased in the 1990 documentary ''[[Paris Is Burning (film)|Paris Is Burning]]'' (which went on to win the Grand Jury Prize at the 1991 [[Sundance Film Festival]]).<ref name=":1">{{Cite journal|last=Becquer|first=Marcos|last2=Gatti|first2=Jose|date=1991-09-01|title=Elements of Vogue|journal=Third Text|volume=5|issue=16-17|pages=65–81|doi=10.1080/09528829108576327|issn=0952-8822}}</ref> In its modern form, this dance has become a global phenomenon that continues to evolve both stylistically and demographically.<ref name=":2">{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2015/07/22/arts/dance/20150726-vogue.html|title=Vogueing Is Still Burning Up the Dance Floor in New York|last=Schaefer|first=Brian|date=2015-07-23|work=The New York Times|access-date=2017-05-01|issn=0362-4331}}</ref>
== History == Inspired by the style of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphs and the famous model poses of ''[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]]'' magazine, voguing is characterized by model-like poses integrated with angular, linear, and rigid arm, leg, and body movements.<ref name=":0" /> This style of dance arose from [[Harlem]] [[Ball culture|ballrooms]] by [[African-American]] drag queens of the early 1960s and their tradition in throwing "shade," or a subtle insult directed to other queens in order to impress the judges. It was originally called "presentation" and later "performance".<ref name=":3">{{Cite journal|last=Jackson|first=Jonathan David|date=Autumn 2002|title=The Social World of Voguing|url=http://jashm.press.illinois.edu/12.2/12-2TheSocial_Jackson26-42.pdf|journal=Journal for the Anthropological Study of Human Movement|volume=12.2|pages=26–42}}</ref> Over the years, the dance evolved into the more intricate and acrobatic form that is now called "vogue".<ref name=":1" /><ref name=":2" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/janet-upadhye/vogue-not-madonnas-dance_b_1613478.html|title=Vogue: Not Madonna's Dance|last=Upadhye|first=Janet|date=2012-06-21|website=HuffPost|access-date=2017-05-02}}</ref>
The precise origins of voguing are disputed. Although many cite the story in which [[Paris Dupree]] takes out a Vogue magazine and mimics the pose at the beat (and other queens subsequently following), there are other accounts that note voguing may have originated from black gay prison inmates of [[Rikers Island]] for the attention of other men and throwing shade.<ref name=":0" /> Voguing is continually developed further as an established dance form that is practiced in the LGBT [[ballroom scene]] and clubs in major cities throughout the United States and around the globe—mainly New York City and Paris.<ref name=":2" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/french-drag-queen-dance-battles|title=French Drag Queen Dance Battles|last=Veine|first=France|date=March 13, 2014|website=VICE|access-date=April 1, 2017}}</ref>
== Styles == {{Multiple image | direction = vertical | width = 250 | image1 = Voguing Masquerade Ball 3.webm <!--A participant at the [[National Museum of African Art]]'s 2016 Voguing Masquerade Ball--> | image2 = Chise Ninja's Vogue Session - Part 1.webm | footer = Samples of voguing }}
There are currently three distinct styles of vogue: ''Old Way'' (pre-1990); ''New Way'' (post-1990); and V''ogue Fem'' (circa 1995).<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Tara|first=Susman,|date=2000-01-01|title=The Vogue of Life: Fashion Culture, Identity, and the Dance of Survival in the Gay BalIs|journal=disClosure: A Journal of Social Theory|volume=9|issue=1|doi=10.13023/disclosure.09.15|issn=1055-6133}}</ref>
=== Old way === Old way is characterized by the formation of lines, symmetry, and precision in the execution of formations with graceful, fluid-like action. Egyptian hieroglyphs and fashion poses serve as the original inspirations for old way voguing. In its purest, historical form, old way vogue is a duel between two rivals. Traditionally, old way rules dictated that one rival must "pin" the other to win the contest. Pinning involved the trapping of an opponent so that he or she could not execute any movements while the adversary was still in motion (usually voguing movements with the arms and hands called "hand performance" while the opponent was "pinned" against the floor doing "floor exercises" or against a wall).<ref>{{Citation|last=Livingston|first=Jennie|title=Paris Is Burning|date=1991-08-01|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0100332/|first4=Paris|accessdate=2017-05-02}}</ref>
=== New way === New way is characterized by rigid movements coupled with "clicks" (limb contortions at the joints) and "arms control" (hand and wrist illusions, which sometimes includes tutting and [[Locking (dance)|locking]]). New way can also be described as a modified form of [[mime]] in which imaginary geometric shapes, such as a box, are introduced during motion and moved progressively around the dancer's body to display the dancer's dexterity and memory. New way involves incredible flexibility.<ref name=":1" />
=== Vogue Fem === Vogue Fem ("Fem" is derived from the French word ''{{lang|fr|femme}}'', meaning "woman") is fluidity at its most extreme with exaggerated [[Femininity|feminine]] movements influenced by [[ballet]], [[jazz dance|jazz]] and [[modern dance]]. Styles of Vogue Fem performances range from Dramatics (which emphasizes stunts, tricks, and speed) to Soft (which emphasizes a graceful, beautiful, and easy flow continuations between the five elements). There are currently five elements of Vogue Fem: * '''Duckwalk''': The duck walk receives its name from the appearance the name references (a duck walking) that involves squatting on your heels and kicking your feet out as you move forward on the beat. * '''Catwalk ''': Catwalking is an exaggerated feminine walk where the legs are crossed over each other, the hips are thrust from side to side, and the hands are thrown forward in opposition to the legs. * '''Hands''': In performance, the hands of the performer often told a story. This is the component of performing used to throw shade. For example, miming an expression of horror at the way the opponents face looks. * '''Floorwork''': This component demonstrates the competitors' sensuality as they roll, twist, and otherwise move on the ground in such a way as to capture the attention of the judges. * '''Spins and Dips''': This is the showiest component of vogue. These are the turns on beat, and the drops to the floor. A spin or dip is only done correctly when executed with the climax happening on the beat.<ref>{{Citation|last=Oxygen Media|title=The 5 Elements of Vogue with Leiomy Maldonado - In Progress {{!}} Oxygen|date=2016-06-02|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E3c7Gv5RHaw|accessdate=2017-05-02}}</ref>
== Scenes and chapters == The ballroom scene has evolved into a national and international underground [[dancesport]] with major balls and dance competitions being held in different regions of the United States and around the world.<ref>{{Citation|last=streetstar|title=STREETSTAR 2013 - Vogue Femme Final Battle Lasseindra (FRA) vs Ida"Inxi" Holmlund (FIN)|date=2013-08-22|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jhhd_tEaJEQ|accessdate=2017-03-20}}</ref> New York State continues to be the mecca of the ballroom scene as well as the dance style, but regional voguing "capitals" exist—Chicago and Detroit for the Midwest. Atlanta, Charlotte, Dallas, Miami for the South. Los Angeles and Las Vegas for the West Coast. Baltimore, D.C, Connecticut, Philadelphia, Pittsburgh. and Virginia for the East Coast.<ref>{{Cite book|title=Butch queens up in pumps : gender, performance, and ballroom culture in Detroit|last=1969-|first=Bailey, Marlon M.,|isbn=9780472051960|oclc=820123691}}</ref>
International cities in Western Europe (the U.K., France, the Netherlands, Germany, Austria and Sweden), Eastern Europe, Latin America (Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica) and Asia Pacific (Japan and New Zealand) have sprouted and held competitions inspired by voguing from the original balls of New York City.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/voguing-europe-ewen-spencer-clive-martin|title=Inside Eastern Europe's Wild, Competitive Voguing Scene|website=Vice|access-date=2017-05-02}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.catchnews.com/lite/youtube-sensation-japan-aya-sato-bambi-voguing-madonna-nicky-minaj-vogue-magazine-1453190072.html|title=Watch: Aya-Bambi, the Japanese dancing couple who will leave you hypnotised|work=''CatchNews.com''|access-date=2017-05-02}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Morton |first=Frances |date=May 9, 2017 |title=Inside New Zealand's Radical Pacific Queer Community |url=https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/785bmb/vogueing-for-survival-inside-new-zealands-radical-pacific-queer-community |work=Vice |location=New Zealand |access-date=Sep 13, 2017 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Villegas |first=Richard |year=2016 |title=How voguing and ballroom became cool in Latin America. |url=http://remezcla.com/features/music/rise-of-ballroom-culture-latin-america/|work=Remezcla |access-date=May 30, 2018}}</ref>
== Influences == [[File:VogueBlondAmbitionUndergGround.jpg|thumb|[[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]] and her dancers vogueing on the 1990 [[Blond Ambition World Tour]]. The singer brought global exposure to the then-underground dance.]] Several notable pop celebrities and artists were influenced by Voguing. [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]], [[Beyoncé]], [[Rihanna]], [[Willow Smith]], [[FKA Twigs]], [[Ariana Grande]], and [[Azealia Banks]] have all taken inspiration from voguing from dances of past and contemporary voguers, while also incorporating the beats traditionally attached to the dance.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/fashion/fashion-blog/2014/nov/18/-sp-vogueing-dance-came-back-into-vogue-madonna|title=How voguing came back into vogue|last=Hunt|first=Kenya|date=2014-11-18|work=The Guardian|access-date=2017-05-02|issn=0261-3077}}</ref><ref name=":4">{{Cite web|url=http://www.latina.com/lifestyle/inspiring-latina/leiomy-maldonado-vogue-choreographer|title=Meet Leiomy Maldonado, the Trans Latina Vogue Dancer Whose Hair Flip Inspired Beyoncé & More |work=LATINA|access-date=2017-05-02}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.afropunk.com/profiles/blogs/new-music-azealia-banks-new-vogue-worthy-track-the-big-big-beat|title=NEW MUSIC: Azealia Banks' new Vogue-worthy track "The Big Big Beat" is an instant-hit|website=''afropunk.com''|access-date=2017-05-02}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.vibe.com/2017/01/leiomy-maldonado-on-famous-hair-flip/|title=Leiomy Maldonado Talks Signature Hair Flip That Inspired Beyoncé|date=2017-01-25|work=Vibe|access-date=2017-05-02}}</ref>
One of the most recent influences of voguing (and [[Ball culture]]) comes from the documentary film ''[[Kiki (2016 film)|Kiki]]'', in which contemporary Balls and Voguing is represented through the scenes and styles that now exist.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/28/movies/kiki-review.html|title=Review: 'Kiki': The Vogueing Scene, Still a Refuge for Gay and Transgender Youth|last=Kenny|first=Glenn|date=2017-02-28|work=The New York Times|access-date=2017-05-02|issn=0362-4331}}</ref><ref>{{Citation|last=MovieZine|title=Kiki (2016) - Trailer|date=2016-06-30|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ixeDKdMLRHw|accessdate=2017-05-02}}</ref>
When the dance culture of New York travelled to Berlin, many people went to clubs to show off their best moves. At a time when discrimination was very severe especially for those exploring their identities, these clubs offered people a space to avoid those struggles. People focused on their dance and outdoing their peers and competitors rather than society's rejection of minority groups. The House of Melody was the first German voguing house. It brought together people passionate for voguing. They emphasized ignoring people's backgrounds and instead understanding everyone's shared belief in love for all.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://thehouseofmelody.com/|title=the house of melody - HOME|website=''thehouseofmelody.com''|language=de|access-date=2018-03-24}}</ref> These clubs were important for people who might have been looking for a place to escape the challenges that they faced on the streets or at home. The empowerment that was generated in these spaces transferred into contributing to a broader movement that would tend to the struggles of minorities in Germany.

{{Infobox motorsport championship | logo = WeatherTech SportsCar Championship logo.png | pixels = 300px | caption = | country/region = {{flagicon|USA}} [[United States]] | inaugural = 2014 | folded = | drivers = | teams = | tires = [[Michelin]] | LMP classes = Prototype (P) | GT classes = GT Le Mans (GTLM), GT Daytona (GTD) | champion driver = P: {{flagicon|USA}} [[Eric Curran]]

{{flagicon|DNK}} [[Jan Magnussen]]
